elements.title: Mary Jo Shelly (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mary Jo Shelly (pictured) used her background in modern dance and physical education to train women in the military during two wars?

elements.title: Fourth Symphony (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gavriil Popov's Fourth Symphony was not publicly performed until 2023, 74 years after it was composed?

elements.title: Carl A. Schenck (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that German forester Carl A. Schenck founded the first forestry school in North America at George W. Vanderbilt's Biltmore Estate?

elements.title: Smalltime (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Russell Shorto's mobster grandfather was described by one reviewer as the "holy trinity of a reprobate—a drunk, a philanderer, and a cheat" in the 2021 family memoir Smalltime?

elements.title: Earl Witte (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in one of NFL player Earl Witte's only games, he hit a player so hard that the player "stopped, curled up and dropped to the ground as if he had hit a stone wall"?

elements.title: Shows of a Lost World (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Cure's Shows of a Lost World has grossed $37.5 million and become their highest-grossing tour to date, despite the band's refusal to use Ticketmaster's dynamic pricing?

elements.title: Ganjar Pranowo's 2024 presidential campaign (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ganjar Pranowo's 2024 presidential campaign is headquartered in the same building that hosted the incumbent president's 2019 campaign?

elements.title: a vegetable fight (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 15-year-old student was brought to court over throwing an egg during a vegetable fight?
